trans-unit.resname: F01·6 | Swords to Plowshares | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

trans-unit.resname: F01·6 | Swords to Plowshares | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source:
"Peace hath her victories
No less renownd than war."
—John Milton,
"To the Lord General Cromwell"
Whenever Ophidian attacks and isn't blocked, you may draw a card. If you do, Ophidian assigns no combat damage this turn.
"I will ... tell thee more than thou hast wit to ask."\n—Christopher Marlowe, *Doctor Faustus*
Whenever Jackal Pup is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
"Cry havoc and let slip the dogs of war."\n—William Shakespeare, *Julius Caesar*
Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate only once each turn.
"I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately."\n—Henry David Thoreau, *Walden*
At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
"And in their blind and unattaining state their miserable lives have sunk so low that they must envy every other fate."\n—Dante, *Inferno*, trans. Ciardi
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay this spell's mana cost. Fireblast deals 4 damage to any target.
